Busted on the Mac as well.

Definitely is something with code templates.  Selecting a variable or type from the dialog doesn't cause any problems, while hitting ctrl-space after typing sysout does (without opening the dialog).
Rc2 candidate. Needs investigation to see if this is a debug issue.

Moving to JFace Text.

TextViewer uses array lists to store the various listeners it keeps track of.  When looping through the listeners to fire an event, the original list is checked each time.  When the last listener is removed, the list is set to null.

In this case, when the dialog is disposed, the document is set to null.  This fires a document changed event to all of the registered text listeners.  When the NPE occurred, there was only one listener, a LinkedModeUI$Closer.  When this listener receives the event, it removes itself as a listener.  The TextViewer then sets the list to null (as there are no more listeners).  When the list size is checked for the loop, an NPE occurs.

Once the NPE occurs, the dialog does not close properly resulting in many further problems.

One solution would be to use ListenerLists instead of ArrayLists, using the getListeners method to iterate through the listeners.  I started working on this, so if this is the preferred solution, I can attach a patch for it.
Removing milestone for JFace to decide

There's something badly broken with that dialog and hence events are not coming along the right way. The dialog doesn't even seem to be parented.

Do this.
1. go to 'Logical Structures' pref page
2. click 'Add...'
3. now go back to the preference page and change some other settings (WOW)
4. click 'Cancel' or 'OK' on the preference page
==> errors

This happens because you destroy the dialogs shell style when setting your own.

Created bug 188946 to deal with the modal problem in the dialog.  However, even with the shell style fixed, the problem can still occur.  In addition, the problem can occur on the detail formatter dialog as well.

Here are more concrete steps to reproduce:

1) Open the java logical structures preference page. (Java > Debug > Logical Structures)
2) Click Add...
3) Click Browse... select a type such as java.util.Map.
4) Put some text in the description box
5) In the code text viewer, type 'syso' then hit ctrl-space, System.out.println() should be written into the text viewer.
6) Hit OK, the NPE should show up in the log and the dialog will not close properly, further edits to the dialog result in more exceptions.

Created an attachment (id=68627)
Fix

The problem is surfaced by the linked mode UI which is setup when adding a template. The viewer is disposed while linke mode is still up and only exited upon document input about to be changed event. That's why we don't see it in the editor.
Benno, please review for Michael. Thanks.

(In reply to comment #11)
> +1 Sneaky fix, I like it.
> 

Indeed, patch is good:-)

Fixed in HEAD.
Will be in RC2 if there's another build today.
Thanks for getting the fix in, our dialog is working nicely now.
Curtis, why did you remove the reviewers, target milestone flags? Please restore the bug to its previous state. Thanks.

Sorry, that is really strange.  I only entered a comment, but must have had the page in an odd state.  I am putting the milestone back to RC2.  Not sure how to put the reviews back, the comments from Darin and Benno are available.
